com.percussion.services.assembly.impl.finder
Class PSBaseSlotContentFinder

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.services.assembly.impl.finder.PSBaseSlotContentFinder
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSExtension, IPSSlotContentFinder
public abstract class PSBaseSlotContentFinder
extends Object
implements IPSSlotContentFinder

The base slot content finder provides the common functionality needed by each slot content finder implementation. The general pattern (not followed for managed nav) is to implement the abstract getSlotItems(IPSAssemblyItem, IPSTemplateSlot, Map) method. This method provides the information to a general implementation of the find(IPSAssemblyItem, IPSTemplateSlot, Map) method.

The base class' find method filters and organizes the returned slot items into a set of assembly items to be assembled.

Author:
dougrand

PSBaseSlotContentFinder

Method Detail

getSlotItems

protected abstract Set<PSBaseSlotContentFinder.SlotItem> getSlotItems(IPSAssemblyItem sourceItem,
                                                                      IPSTemplateSlot slot,
                                                                      Map<String,Object> selectors)
                                                               throws RepositoryException,
                                                                      PSFilterException,
                                                                      PSAssemblyException
Get the slot items to be operated on. The items do not need to be ordered or filtered. This method is supplied by an implementer and is normally called by the find(IPSAssemblyItem, IPSTemplateSlot, Map) method to get initial content.

It is important to note that while this mechanism works well for most cases, there may be cases where an implementer must simply write their own find method.

Parameters:
sourceItem - the source assembly item, guaranteed never null because this is called from find(IPSAssemblyItem, IPSTemplateSlot, Map)
slot - the slot, guaranteed never null because this is called from find(IPSAssemblyItem, IPSTemplateSlot, Map)
selectors - the selectors, may be null
Returns:
a set of slot items, never null, that can be filtered, ordered and turned into assembly items. The set must be ordered if the slots are to be ordered. Use PSBaseSlotContentFinder.SlotItemOrder to order slot items in the set.
Throws:
RepositoryException
PSFilterException
PSAssemblyException

find

public List<IPSAssemblyItem> find(IPSAssemblyItem sourceItem,
                                  IPSTemplateSlot slot,
                                  Map<String,Object> selectors)
                           throws RepositoryException,
                                  PSFilterException,
                                  PSAssemblyException
Description copied from interface: IPSSlotContentFinder
Calculate the related items given the configuration of the slot finder instance. The returned ids are ordered. Important information for the rendering of the returned items will be contained in the variables bound in each item, for example, the url of the item for use in a snippet.

This method looks up the filter specified in the source item in the sys_itemfilter parameter and then calls the "regular" find method.

Specified by:
find in interface IPSSlotContentFinder
Parameters:
sourceItem - the source content id, never null and must exist in the repository
slot - the slot that the finder is being invoked for, never null
selectors - a set of zero or more parameters, never null. Standard parameter names are defined as constants on this interface.
Returns:
an array of zero or more ordered related slot items, never null, but may be empty
Throws:
RepositoryException - if the source content id does not exist or there is another error in running the slot content finder
PSFilterException - if the named filter is not found
PSAssemblyException - if a problem occurs with the assembly service

getCloneAssemblyItem

protected IPSAssemblyItem getCloneAssemblyItem(IPSAssemblyItem originalItem,
                                               IPSAssemblyService asm,
                                               String templatename,
                                               IPSGuid itemid,
                                               IPSGuid templateid,
                                               Map<String,IPSGuid> optionalParams)
                                        throws CloneNotSupportedException,
                                               PSAssemblyException,
                                               PSCmsException
Clone and setup the assembly item in preparation to create an item for the content in the slot.

Parameters:
originalItem - the original assembly item, never null
asm - the assembly service, never null
templatename - the name of the template to assemble, might be null
itemid - the guid for the item being assembled, never null
templateid - the id of the template, may be null, but either templatename or templateid must be specified
optionalParams - optional parameters to add, may be empty but not null
Returns:
item for content in slot
Throws:
CloneNotSupportedException
PSAssemblyException
PSCmsException

                 File codeRoot)

Description copied from interface: IPSExtension
Initializes this extension.

Note that the extension will have permission to read and write any files or directiors under codeRoot (recursively). The extension will not have permissions for any other files or directories.

Specified by:
init in interface IPSExtension
Parameters:
def - The extension def, which contains configuration info and initialization params.
codeRoot - The root directory where this extension should install and look for any files relating to itself. The subdirectory structure under codeRoot is left up to the extension implementation. Must not be null.
Throws:
PSExtensionException - If the codeRoot does not exist, or is not accessible. Also thrown for any other initialization errors that will prohibit this extension from doing its job correctly, such as invalid or missing properties.

reorder

protected Set<PSBaseSlotContentFinder.SlotItem> reorder(Set<PSBaseSlotContentFinder.SlotItem> rval,
                                                        String orderby)
Deprecated. use reorder(Set, String, String) instead.

Reorder the return set by a different algorithm. This first extracts the content ids from the set. Then it does a JSR-170 query with the order by clause on 'nt:base' and this returns the content ids. That is then turned into a map that yields ascending sort order, which is used with a different comparator. Calls reorder(Set, String, String) with no locale.

Parameters:
rval - the original results, may be empty but not null
orderby - the orderby string, never null or empty
Returns:
the reordered set

reorder

protected Set<PSBaseSlotContentFinder.SlotItem> reorder(Set<PSBaseSlotContentFinder.SlotItem> rval,
                                                        String orderby,
                                                        String locale)
Reorder the return set by a different algorithm. This first extracts the content ids from the set. Then it does a JSR-170 query with the order by clause on 'nt:base' and this returns the content ids. That is then turned into a map that yields ascending sort order, which is used with a different comparator.

Parameters:
rval - the original results, may be empty but not null
orderby - the orderby string, never null or empty
locale - the locale to use in the search to ensure the correct collating sequence. If null or empty the JVM locale is used.
Returns:
the reordered set

getLocale

protected String getLocale(IPSAssemblyItem source,
                           Map<String,? extends Object> args,
                           Map<String,Object> selectors)
Get the locale from the available information. The default value is taken from the source node using the sys_lang field.

Parameters:
source - the source assembly item, never null.
args - the arguments, never null
selectors - the selectors, never null
Returns:
the locale, or null if it cannot be determined. The returned locale will be in normal form with an underscore for use with java, i.e. en_us not en-us.
